title: FULL OF HELL Grinds Hard On New Single "Broken Sword, Rotten Shield"
description: Their new EP is due out next week. The post FULL OF HELL Grinds Hard On New Single "Broken Sword, Rotten Shield" appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 7 hours ago
excerpt: Their new EP is due out next week.
text: Full of Hell is here to grind your ears into dust with their latest single "Broken Sword, Rotten Shield". The single comes from a 10" EP of the same name due out May 16, which you can pre-order right here. On the track, Full of Hell vocalist Dylan Walker said it's an "…introduction to the theme of the EP. The dog knights represent these pure defenders against a world of darkness and the feeling of utter grief and defeat when we lose these companions. Along side that metaphor, the song also explains that in this world, all living things are rendered equal in the end, and for some that's a mighty fall." Full of Hell and Harm's Way recently announced a co-headlining North American tour with Kruelty, Jarhead Fertilizer, and Clique for this May and June. The tour begins after some festival appearances on May 19 at the Blueberry Hill Duck Room in St Louis, MO, and wraps up on June 8 at The Axis Club in Toronto, ON. Get your tickets here. 5/15 Daytona, FL Welcome to Rockville (Harm's Way & Full of Hell only)5/16 Athens, GA Georgia Theatre (Harm's Way, Full of Hell, Sanguisugabogg, Gridiron & Mutilatred)5/18 Milwaukee, WI Milwaukee Metal Fest (no Kruelty or Clique)5/19 St Louis, MO Blueberry Hill Duck Room5/20 Louisville, KY Portal5/21 Nashville, TN Exit/In5/23 Denton, TX Rubber Gloves5/24 Austin, TX Empire Garage5/25 Houston, TX The Secret Group5/27 Atlanta, GA The Masquerade5/28 Durham, NC Motorco Music Hall5/30 Richmond, VA The Canal Club5/31 Baltimore, MD Baltimore Soundstage6/1 Philadelphia, PA Underground Arts6/2 New York, NY Bowery Ballroom6/4 Amityville, NY Amityville Music Hall6/5 Hartford, CT Webster Underground6/6 Boston, MA The Middle East6/7 Montreal, QC Theatre Fairmount6/8 Toronto, ON The Axis Club Want More Metal? html:
Full of Hell is here to grind your ears into dust with their latest single "Broken Sword, Rotten Shield". The single comes from a 10" EP of the same name due out May 16, which you can pre-order right here.

On the track, Full of Hell vocalist Dylan Walker said it's an "…introduction to the theme of the EP. The dog knights represent these pure defenders against a world of darkness and the feeling of utter grief and defeat when we lose these companions. Along side that metaphor, the song also explains that in this world, all living things are rendered equal in the end, and for some that's a mighty fall."

Full of Hell and Harm's Way recently announced a co-headlining North American tour with Kruelty, Jarhead Fertilizer, and Clique for this May and June. The tour begins after some festival appearances on May 19 at the Blueberry Hill Duck Room in St Louis, MO, and wraps up on June 8 at The Axis Club in Toronto, ON. Get your tickets here.
